Package net.jodah.expiringmap

Class ExpiringValue<V>

java.lang.Object
net.jodah.expiringmap.ExpiringValue<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of value being stored
public final class ExpiringValue<V>
extends java.lang.Object
A value which should be stored in an ExpiringMap with optional control over its expiration.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ExpiringValue​(V value)
    Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap.
    ExpiringValue​(V value, long duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)

    ExpiringValue​(V value, ExpirationPolicy expirationPolicy)
    Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap.
    ExpiringValue​(V value, ExpirationPolicy expirationPolicy, long duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
    Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap.

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpiringValue

      public ExpiringValue​(V value)
      Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap. The map's default values for expiration policy and ExpiringMap.getExpiration() expiration} will be used.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to store
      See Also:
      ExpiringMap.put(Object, Object)

    • ExpiringValue

      public ExpiringValue​(V value, ExpirationPolicy expirationPolicy)
      Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap. The map's default ExpiringMap.getExpiration() expiration} will be used.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to store
      expirationPolicy - the expiration policy for the value
      See Also:
      ExpiringMap.put(Object, Object, ExpirationPolicy)

    • ExpiringValue

      public ExpiringValue​(V value, long duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap. The map's default expiration policy will be used.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to store
      duration - the length of time after an entry is created that it should be removed
      timeUnit - the unit that duration is expressed in
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - on null timeUnit
      See Also:
      ExpiringMap.put(Object, Object, long, TimeUnit)

    • ExpiringValue

      public ExpiringValue​(V value, ExpirationPolicy expirationPolicy, long duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Creates an ExpiringValue to be stored in an ExpiringMap.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to store
      duration - the length of time after an entry is created that it should be removed
      timeUnit - the unit that duration is expressed in
      expirationPolicy - the expiration policy for the value
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - on null timeUnit
      See Also:
      ExpiringMap.put(Object, Object, ExpirationPolicy, long, TimeUnit)
